element.name: Way of Bird of Hermes
element.description:
The Disciple Bird of Hermes comes from the tradition: Way of the Astral Self and infuses it with the Soul Bird. Monks of this path relinquish their wings and reveal their astral form, a representation of their will. They are philosophers of volition and pain — to understand freedom, one must first touch pain.
"Bird of Hermes is my name, cut thy wings to make me tame."

element.name: Wings of Untamed Wind
element.supports: Monastic Tradition, Way of Bird of Hermes
element.description: As a bonus action, spend 1 ki to summon spectral wings of untamed wind for 10 minutes (end early if you are incapacitated or die). Each creature of your choice within 10 feet makes a Dexterity save or takes force damage equal to two rolls of your Martial Arts die. The wings hover near your scaphoids. While active: • You may use Wisdom instead of Strength for Strength checks and saving throws. • You can make unarmed strikes with the spectral wings; reach with these attacks is increased by 5 feet. • Attacks with the wings use Wisdom for attack and damage and deal force damage. • Soul Sense: Sense living creatures within 15 feet (30 feet at 6th level) through walls/darkness (you feel presence, you do not see). • Spirit Combo: When you hit with Untamed Wings, you can make one Unarmed Strike as a bonus action without spending ki (stacks with Martial Arts). • Whispering Soul: Once per long rest, telepathically speak a short phrase to a creature within 30 feet. • Spirit Infusion (from 4th level): Your Unarmed Strikes and Astral attacks count as magical for overcoming resistance and immunity.

element.name: Soul Dive
element.supports: Monastic Tradition, Way of Bird of Hermes
element.description: As a bonus action, spend 1 ki to teleport up to 15 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

element.name: Sword of the Messenger
element.supports: Monastic Tradition, Way of Bird of Hermes
element.description:
You can summon the visage of your astral self (as per Arms/Visage of the Astral Self thematics). While the spectral visage is present: • Astral Sight: See normally in magical and nonmagical darkness to 120 ft. • Wisdom of the Spirit: Advantage on Wisdom (Insight) and Charisma (Intimidation) checks. • Word of the Spirit: Direct your voice to one creature within 60 ft (only it hears) or amplify so all within 600 ft hear.
Astral Blade (Soul Reaver’s Edge): As a bonus action, spend 1 ki to summon a spectral blade for 10 minutes. Choose Force, Radiant, or Necrotic damage on summon. Use Wisdom for attack and damage; damage is 1d8 + Wisdom. • Soul Wound: On a hit, target makes a Con save (DC 8 + Prof + Wis). On failure, it takes +1d6 damage and loses any resistances until the end of your next turn. • Soul Edge: First successful hit each time you summon the blade deals an extra 1d4 + Wisdom (improves to 1d6 at 11th level, 1d8 at 17th). • Soul Sever Utility: While the blade is active, you can see invisible creatures and sense living ones within 30 ft; the first attack against you each round has disadvantage as your spirit shields you.

element.name: Iron Will
element.supports: Monastic Tradition, Way of Bird of Hermes
element.description: When a creature hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction and spend 1 ki to force the attacker to reroll the attack, taking the lower result. When you do so, reduce the damage you take by 1d10 + Wisdom modifier (minimum 1). If it still hits, half the damage is transferred to your spirit. Use once per short rest (twice at 14th level).

element.name: Will and the Blade
element.supports: Monastic Tradition, Way of Bird of Hermes
element.description: When you have both astral wings and blade summoned, the astral body manifests (no action). While present: • Empowered Wings: Once per turn when you hit with Wings of Untamed Wind, deal extra damage equal to your Martial Arts die. • Your spirit can move up to 50 ft away from you; both your body and spirit may each attack once per turn. • Creatures within 10 ft of your spirit gain temp HP equal to your Wisdom modifier at the start of their turn. • When your spirit scores a critical hit, your body gains advantage on its next attack.

element.name: Soul Rend
element.supports: Monastic Tradition, Way of Bird of Hermes
element.description: When you slay a creature, capture a fragment of its essence as a Soul Echo (max 3). Expend a Soul Echo to deal +1d8 force damage on an attack (you may expend multiple). All echoes fade after a long rest.

element.name: Phoenix
element.supports: Monastic Tradition, Way of Bird of Hermes
element.description: As a bonus action, spend 5 ki to fully awaken your astral self for 10 minutes (ends early if incapacitated or you die). While awakened: • Armor of the Spirit: +2 bonus to AC. • Astral Barrage: When you would make two attacks with Extra Attack, you can instead make three attacks if all are with your astral wings. • All your attacks deal Soul Damage, ignoring resistance and immunity. • On a critical hit, the target must make a Wisdom save (DC 8 + Prof + Wis) or be Stunned until the end of your next turn. • The effect lasts for 1 minute. • When the awakening ends, if you would drop to 0 HP, you instead remain at 1 HP (once per long rest). • Each time you kill a creature during the awakening, allies within 10 ft regain HP equal to your Wisdom modifier.

element.name: Messenger Thyself
element.supports: Monastic Tradition, Way of Bird of Hermes
element.description: If you die, your spirit continues to fight for 1 minute in its awakened form. Your spirit regains HP each turn equal to your Wisdom modifier + half your Monk level. If your spirit slays a creature during this time, your body immediately revives with 1 HP. Once per long rest.

element.name: Optional Soul Techniques (Additions)
element.supports: Monastic Tradition, Way of Bird of Hermes
element.description: Optional Additions: • Level 4: Spirit Infusion — Unarmed Strikes and Astral attacks count as magical. • Level 5: Soul Step — Spend 1 Ki (Bonus Action) to teleport 15 ft without provoking opportunity attacks. • Level 7+: Soul Tether — Bind a creature’s soul for 1 round; it can’t teleport or shift planes. • Level 10+: Soul Pulse — Once per short rest, unleash a 10‑ft wave of spiritual energy for 2d8 + Wis force damage. • Level 15+: Ki Devour — If a Soul‑Wounded target dies within 10 ft, regain 1 Ki point.
